agenda: 2. Tailoring our solution towards an Agile work environment
3. Leveraging Copilot for integration into our ecosystem
4. Discussing the use of meeting minutes and ticket generation
5. Designing a centralized dashboard for managing meetings
summary: 1. Steven Yuen began the meeting by emphasizing the need to differentiate our solution from Copilot. He highlighted the gaps in Copilot, such as its lack of integration with Agile work environments. Steven suggested focusing on making our solution Agile-focused and tailoring it towards Telstra's needs.

2. The discussion revolved around whether to leverage Copilot or build our own solution. Jason Hong proposed integrating Copilot into our ecosystem in the long term, but Steven expressed concerns about wasted resources if we eventually migrate to Copilot. The group acknowledged the strategic partnership with Copilot and the possibility of collaborating to integrate our solution.

3. The group agreed that a centralized dashboard would be a valuable feature, allowing for a seamless transition between meetings and providing a consistent timeline. The need to address Telstra's specific requirements and challenges with Agile meetings was emphasized.

4. Steven mentioned the potential value of meeting minutes and retrospectives for Telstra employees, but Chris Qu highlighted that retrospectives might not be well-received by team members. David Gailey suggested focusing on the usefulness of a centralized dashboard and improving the employee experience.

5. Steven expressed his intention to research Agile methodologies and the design of a centralized dashboard. He requested input from the team on potential solutions and committed to balancing existing work with the new requirements.
actionItems: 1. Steven will follow up to obtain requirements files.
2. The team will reconvene for further discussion and updates on progress.

Steven Yuen:: Research and identify features that cater to Agile work environments.
Investigate the use of a centralized dashboard for managing meetings.
Determine how the solution can differentiate itself from Copilot.
Gather requirements and file from the stakeholders.
Chase up the requirements from the stakeholders.
Jason Hong:: Continue working on current tasks and projects.
Discuss the issue of Copilot access with Steven Yuen and find a solution.
David Gailey:: Support the shift towards an Agile focus for the solution.
Assist in identifying unique features and value proposition compared to Copilot.
Chris Qu:: Participate in discussions and provide input on the direction of the solution.
Assist in determining the necessary features for the Telstra-focused solution.
Chase up the requirements from the stakeholders.
All team members:: Collaborate on integrating Copilot into the solution in the long term.

detail: - Welcome everyone to the meeting
- Review of previous meeting discussions on Copilot and its limitations
- Discuss ways to distinguish our product from Copilot
- Identify the gaps in Copilot that we can address
- Focus on tailoring our solution to the Agile work environment
- Explore the concept of integrating our solution with Agile practices
- Discuss how our solution can reduce time-consuming administrative tasks
- Brainstorm ideas for making the most out of Agile contexts
- Address the possibility of integrating Copilot into our solution in the long term
- Discuss the benefits and challenges of leveraging Copilot's features
- Consider the potential waste of resources if we create our own solution
- Determine the role of meeting minutes in Agile meetings
- Discuss the usefulness of retrospectives and potential ways to improve them
- Evaluate if meeting minutes and ticket generation should be our main focus
- Examine the need for a centralized dashboard to manage Agile meetings
- Highlight the value of a consistent timeline and meeting flow
- Discuss the importance of differentiation through unique features
- Assign tasks to team members based on the discussion
- Follow-up on accessing Copilot and gathering requirements
- Set expectations for the timeline and prototype development
- Record action items and assign responsibilities
- Recap the main points discussed during the meeting
- Confirm the date and time for the next meeting

agenda.note: This agenda may be subject to adjustments based on further input and requirements from stakeholders.

jira_tickets.title: Agile Work Environment Integration
jira_tickets.description: Investigate and implement features to align the solution with Telstra's agile work environment, such as support for different types of agile meetings and ceremonies.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The solution should provide features that are tailored to agile work practices and support different types of agile meetings. It should integrate seamlessly with Telstra's existing agile tools and workflows.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a project manager, I want a central dashboard to integrate all agile meetings and provide a consistent timeline so that I can easily track and manage all project activities.

jira_tickets.title: Contextual Output Generation
jira_tickets.description: Develop functionality to use the transcripts of past meetings as context to generate more accurate and valuable output for future meetings.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The solution should analyze past meeting transcripts and use the context to generate meeting outputs that are tailored to the specific meeting type. The generated output should provide valuable insights and recommendations based on the accumulated knowledge from past meetings.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a team member, I want an AI-powered solution that generates meeting minutes tailored for agile ceremonies, such as retros, stand-ups, and planning sessions, so that I can have a clear record of discussions and action items.

jira_tickets.title: Centralized Dashboard
jira_tickets.description: Create a centralized dashboard to manage and track all meetings and their associated artifacts, providing a seamless experience for users.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The dashboard should allow users to easily schedule, manage, and track meetings. It should provide visibility into meeting details, attendees, agenda, and generated outputs. The dashboard should also support integration with Telstra's existing tools and systems.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a Telstra executive, I want a solution that provides a transcript of agile meetings and generates reports based on the meeting content so that I can gain insights and make informed decisions.

jira_tickets.title: Copilot Integration and Customization
jira_tickets.description: Explore the possibility of integrating Telstra's solution with Copilot, tailoring it to meet specific business needs and leveraging the existing platform.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The integration with Copilot should allow Telstra's solution to complement and enhance the functionalities provided by Copilot. The integration should be seamless and provide added value to Telstra's users. Customization options should be explored to align with Telstra's unique requirements.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a user of an agile work environment, I want a solution that automates repetitive administrative tasks, such as generating tickets and updating progress, so that I can focus more on actual work.

jira_tickets.title: Meeting Minutes Tailoring
jira_tickets.description: Modify the meeting minutes feature to align with different meeting types, such as retros, stand-ups, and ceremonies, to provide more relevant and useful outputs.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The meeting minutes feature should be enhanced to adapt to different meeting types and generate meeting summaries that are tailored to the specific purpose of the meeting. The tailored meeting minutes should provide key highlights, action items, and insights based on the discussions and outcomes of each meeting type.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a Telstra employee, I want a cost-effective agile project management tool that offers similar features as Copilot but can be tailored specifically for Telstra's needs, so that we can save costs without compromising functionality.

retro_actions: Differentiate our product with an Agile focus: Tailor our solution towards an Agile work environment, since this is something that the current copilot solution lacks. This can include features that reduce time-consuming administrative tasks and cater specifically to Agile ceremonies such as retrospectives and stand-ups.

Make the most out of the context window: Ensure that our solution can accumulate knowledge from past meetings and use it to provide valuable insights. This can involve improving the meeting generator to take into account the purpose of the meeting (retro, stand-up, ceremony) and adjust the output accordingly.

Create a centralized dashboard: Differentiate our product by developing a central dashboard that allows users to manage and track all their meetings and associated tasks. This will add value by providing a centralized and streamlined experience, which is currently lacking in the copilot solution.

Integrate with copilot in the long term: While access to copilot is currently limited, we can consider integrating our solution with copilot in the future. This will require collaboration and co-development with Microsoft, leveraging our strategic partnership, and allowing for a more seamless experience for users.

Investigate Telstra-specific needs: Research and analyze Telstra's Agile work environment and identify any specific requirements and pain points that can be addressed by our solution. This will enable us to create a product that is tailored to Telstra's needs and provides a unique value proposition.
Gather requirements: Chase up the requirements from the product stakeholders, such as the business and executive teams, to ensure that their needs are considered in the development of the solution.

<v Qu, Chris>So with the copilot stuff now like, are we, like gonna just, like, do a brief mention about what we had originally, like the meeting minutes? Stuff like, is that just gonna get scrapped or are we still keeping you?</v>

<v Yuen, Steven>I think meeting minutes will be part of it, right? 'cause like even in. OK, I'm kinda guessing what agile is like right now. There's different types of agile meetings, right? You've got Retros you've got.</v>
